objects.name: NCSC
objects.description: Organization credited as the author of the YARA rules in the report and the publisher of the malware analysis content.

objects.name: UMBRELLA STAND default C2
objects.description: Hardcoded default C2 IP used by UMBRELLA STAND for fake TLS communications on port 443.

objects.name: Hidden actor directory
objects.description: Hidden directory used by UMBRELLA STAND components for storage, persistence, and evasion on Fortinet devices.

objects.name: Shell output buffer file
objects.description: Temporary results file created by UMBRELLA STAND First shell implementation for command output collection and exfiltration.

objects.name: Chunk collection state file
objects.description: INI state file used by UMBRELLA STAND Second shell implementation to track collected chunks (as per IoC table).

objects.name: LD_PRELOAD configuration
objects.description: Modified/used by UMBRELLA STAND to achieve persistence by loading libguic.so into new processes.

objects.name: LD_PRELOAD-injected library
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND shared object loaded via /etc/ld.so.preload to bootstrap/load other components.

objects.name: Fake process name
objects.description: Hardcoded process name string used by blghtd to spoof its name in process listings.

objects.name: Injected tooling log path
objects.description: Path string present in injected tooling; may be used for temporary logging by UMBRELLA STAND components.

objects.name: Injected library path
objects.description: Library path passed to dskz for injection into PID 1 (init); likely corresponds to the reboot_hooker component.

objects.name: BusyBox renamed binary
objects.description: Actor-deployed BusyBox binary renamed to lidwok and stored in the hidden .ztls directory.

objects.name: umbrella stand
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND is a collection of actor binaries targeting Fortinet FortiGate devices (observed on FortiGate 100D series). It provides remote shell execution, configurable beacon frequency and C2 IP, and AES-encrypted C2 communications. It beacons over port 443 using fake TLS (application data without a handshake), supports file reading and staged collection, and implements two shell command modes via ash and BusyBox (renamed to 'lidwok'). The suite employs process injection (via an external injector), process name spoofing (/bin/httpsd), string encryption, hidden directories (/data2/.ztls/), and abuse of a Fortinet sysctl binary to hide files. Persistence indicators include hooking the device reboot function (a 'reboot_hooker' component likely injected into PID 1) and ldpreload of libguic.so to load other components. A default hardcoded C2 IP of 89.44.194.32 was observed, with AES-CBC traffic using a fixed IV and a per-server key. Components called out include blghtd (networking), jvnlpe (watchdog), cisz (initialization and injection launcher), libguic.so (ldpreload loader), and a reboot hooker. The malware also implements a CRC32-based host ID for C2 tracking, and a staged sleep pattern before using configured intervals.

objects.name: Fortinet
objects.description: Vendor of the targeted FortiGate firewalls and FortiOS platform referenced in the report.

objects.name: UMBRELLA_STAND_stack_constants_used_for_crypt
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule UMBRELLA_STAND_stack_constants_used_for_crypt
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identifies UMBRELLA STAND sample based on
encrypted stack strings."
        date = "2025-06-18"
    strings:
        $ = {C6 45 D0 92 C6 45 D1 48 C6 45 D2 D6 C6 45 D3 E3 C6 45
D4 39 C6 45 D5 EE C6 45 D6 CE C6 45 D7 E4 C6 45 D8 59 C6 45 D9 58
C6 45 DA 97 C6 45 DB E5 C6 45 DC 2E C6 45 DD 27 C6 45 DE 98 C6 45
DF DE C6 45 E0 93 C6 45 E1 A8 C6 45 E2 77 C6 45 E3 9B C6 45 E4 4A
C6 45 E5 F0 C6 45 E6 EF C6 45 E7 74 C6 45 E8 80 C6 45 E9 2D C6 45
EA EB C6 45 EB 30 C6 45 EC 1F C6 45 ED B5 C6 45 EE D9 C6 45 EF C7}
// Key
        $ = {C6 45 C0 77 C6 45 C1 90 C6 45 C2 3D C6 45 C3 35 C6 45
C4 A4 C6 45 C5 9F C6 45 C6 0F C6 45 C7 5E C6 45 C8 F5 C6 45 C9 52
C6 45 CA 44 C6 45 CB 69 C6 45 CC B9 C6 45 CD C0 C6 45 CE BA C6 45
CF DC} // IV
    condition:
        uint32(0) == 0x464C457F and
        any of them
}

objects.name: UMBRELLA_STAND_plaintext_of_encrypted_stings
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule UMBRELLA_STAND_plaintext_of_encrypted_stings
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identifies UMBRELLA STAND sample based on
strings, if string obfuscation is not present."
        date = "2025-06-18"
    strings:
        $ = {ED B8 83 20}
        $ = "%s/%d.sv"
        $ = "%s/%s.ini"
        $ = "%s>%s 2>&1"
        $ = "%[^=]=%[^=]"
        $ = "/data2/.ztls/"
        $ = "/proc/%s/status"
        $ = "%*s %s"
        $ = "./lidwok killall blghtd"
        $ = "89.44.194.32"
        $ = "/data2/.ztls/lidwok"
    condition:
        uint32(0) == 0x464C457F and
        5 of them
}

objects.name: UMBRELLA_STAND_injected_tool_load_mechanism
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule UMBRELLA_STAND_injected_tool_load_mechanism
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identifies UMBRELLA STAND sample based on
strings present in tooling."
        date = "2025-06-18"
    strings:
        $ = "LoadMsg"
        $ = "/bin/httpsd"
        $ = "/proc/%d/cmdline"
        $ = "/tmp/logx"
        $ = "error"
    condition:
        uint32(0) == 0x464C457F and
        all of them
}

objects.name: UMBRELLA_STAND_deobfuscated_custom_base64_and_encryption_key
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule UMBRELLA_STAND_deobfuscated_custom_base64_and_encryption_key
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identifies UMBRELLA STAND sample based on
custom base64 alphabet and encryption key reference."
        date = "2025-06-18"
    strings:

        $ = ",((@=+utivp45ztvo6&RFvt&*^tp&!q;"
        $ =
"ef345FGHIJKLMNOPWghijklmnoXYd67TUVABC89+/pqrstQRSDEZabcuvwxyz012"

    condition:
        uint32(0) == 0x464C457F and
        any of them
}

objects.name: UMBRELLA_STAND_strings_used_in_firewall_malware
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule UMBRELLA_STAND_strings_used_in_firewall_malware
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identifies UMBRELLA STAND sample based on
strings."
        date = "2025-06-18"
    strings:
        $ = "/bin/httpsd"
        $ = "dxumbsu"
        $ = "/proc/%d/cmdline"
        $ = "/tmp/logx"
        $ = "/etc/ld.so.preload"
        $ = "loadMsg"
        $ ="/SYSV64564856"
    condition:
        uint32(0) == 0x464C457F and
        all of them
}

objects.name: UMBRELLA_STAND_injection_related_strings
objects.description: YARA rule to detect related activity.
objects.pattern:
rule UMBRELLA_STAND_injection_related_strings
{
    meta:
        author = "NCSC"
        description = "Identifies UMBRELLA STAND sample based on
strings used to configure injection."
        date = "2025-06-18"
    strings:
        $ = "/SYSV64564856"
        $ = "/etc/ld.so.preload"
        $ = "version 2"
        $ = "init_drivercheck"
    condition:
        uint32(0) == 0x464C457F and
        3 of them
}

objects.name: Command and Scripting Interpreter: Unix Shell
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND contains functionality to receive and run Shell commands.

objects.name: Deobfuscate/Decode Files or Information
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND contains AES-encrypted strings.

objects.name: Process Injection
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND uses tooling to perform process injection.

objects.name: Indicator Removal: File Deletion
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND binaries had been deleted from the device.

objects.name: Hide Artifacts: Process Argument Spoofing
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND modifies it’s process name.

objects.name: Hide Artifacts: Hidden Files and Directories
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND and associated tooling use hidden directories.

objects.name: Boot or Logon Autostart Execution: Kernel Modules and Extensions
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND has functionality to modify reboot to achieve persistence.

objects.name: Hijack Execution Flow: Dynamic Linker Hijacking
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND has functionality to load via ldpreload.

objects.name: Process Discovery
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND performs process discovery to check that its main process is still executing.

objects.name: Network Service Discovery
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND was in use with nbtscan which can list NetBIOS computer names.

objects.name: Network Sniffing
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND was in use with tcpdump which can be, and was, used to perform packet captures.

objects.name: Data Obfuscation: Protocol or Service Impersonation
objects.description: UMBRELLA STAND uses fake TLS for communications with the C2 server.

objects.name: Analisi Malware: Umbrella Stand
objects.description: This report contains technical analysis and indicators associated with malware. umbrella stand.
